communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Cancelation of Political Rewind
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails, text messages and correspondence regarding the cancelation of Political Rewind with Bill Nigut and related programming changes at Georgia Public Broadcasting from May 1, 2023 to the present. This would include emails and text messages between employees and Commissioners (Brian Dill, Jerald Mitchell, Cecil Staton) of the Georgia Public Telecommunications Commission, also known as Georgia Public Broadcasting, employees of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (employees possessing email addresses that end in @ajc.com), Cox Media Group (@cmg.com or @coxmediagroup.com), and Cox Enterprises (@coxinc.com, @cox.com, and @coxenterprises.com), the Gov.'s office and any members of the state legislature including panelists on the show.
Also any correspondence with NPR, the NPR Board of Directors, NPR's Public Editor, and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting over the cancelation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Patrick Bannon

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holland Disciplinary Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The complete disciplinary records of corrections officer Evan J. Holland and sergeant Jason M. Holland.

Citing the FOIL Subject Matter List of the Department of Corrections and Community Supervision last known to be updated February 16, 2021, the record would be listed under subheading "EMPLOYEE SUBJECTS" where this describes the following described records:

* Employee Investigations
* Executive Facility Files
* Human Resources/Personnel
* Labor Relations

Per legislation signed by the Governor on June 12, 2020, as Chapter 96 of the New York State Laws of 2020, these are now subject to release upon request through the state's Freedom of Information Law; records may not be withheld citing New York State Civil Rights Law 50-a (repealed).

Explicitly releasable are records including:

* complaints, allegations, and charges;
* the name of the employee complained of or charged;
* the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing;
* the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding;
* the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: FOIL Log No. 23-06-360
communications.communication:
[cid:image001.png@01D9A421.986174A0]
Kathy Hochul
Governor
Daniel F. Martuscello III
Acting Commissioner

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law request seeking the complete disciplinary records of corrections officer Evan J. Holland and sergeant Jason M. Holland

We are attempting to determine what, if any, records are available concerning your request.  We expect to be forwarding a response by July 20, 2023.

Brianna White
Assistant Records Access Officer

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This message is intended solely for the designated recipient(s) and may contain confidential information which is legally privileged and protected by law from disclosure. If you are not an intended recipient, any disclosure, copying, use, or distribution of the information included in this e-mail and any attachment(s) is strictly prohibited.

If you received this communication in error, please notify the sender by reply e-mail and immediately and permanently delete this e-mail.

title: FOIA - Gundam franchise (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - Gundam franchise (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning the Gundam media franchise and any of its creative works (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gundam ). The franchise began in 1979 with the anime television show Mobile Suit Gundam.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.communication:

How you will pay

I am limiting my request to the free two hours of searching and 100 duplicated
pages. I am not willing to pay additional fees.

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    All records relating to or mentioning the Gundam media franchise and any of
    its creative works (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gundam ). The
    franchise began in 1979 with the anime television show Mobile Suit Gundam.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    J Ader
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ffoia-gundam-franchise-federal-bureau-of-investigation-147967%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2NfVNjHDTE1Gy_ueXvgrmh4%3A1qBnyY%3AtMAplfP3GBqey_5wnthgTd84pOqdOJs2YfbJsuLTMHk

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.
